column3: This was already mentioned by @molxyz (at least for "Main Window") in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14573.\n\nI'm not entirely sure what's up with "Restore", but for me on Windows and Linux, when I click it, I only get this shadow of the menu around. I also tried adding a shortcut to see if it would do something different (whether minimized or not), but it behaved the same. Not sure wh
@GChuf Thank you! I made this request several times but for some reason it seemed to go into deaf ears. Hopefully this time someone will listen to you.  Thank you very much!  :)

@molxyz surprised to see you here actually, given that it was an "old" issue and I haven't seen you around yet, but I'm glad you responded!\nOnce I saw your comment I confirmed to myself this is an issue that needs to be addressed.
Concept ACK
Concept ACK
Concept ACK

> I made this request several times but for some reason it seemed to go into deaf ears.

Sorry but does https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14573#issuecomment-485954174 means several?

Concept ACK.

Maybe also drop `Minimize` in windows? IIRC the context menu of the window icon has that option?

> I'm not entirely sure what's up with "Restore", but for me on Windows and Linux, when I click it, I only get this shadow of the menu around

That sounds like a Qt bug? Which one are you using?

> Not sure what it does on macOS.

In macos there's the "Zoom" menu item, it toggle between maximized and normal.

> Sorry but does [#14573 (comment)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14573#issuecomment-485954174) means several?

@promag  Excuse me? You think I would lie on this GH repo?  Here are the requests I made for this same issue:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/15555#issuecomment-485907099
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14573#issuecomment-485954174
https://github.com

@molxyz I had no intention in being inappropriate, just genuinely curious which were those several requests, because I was only aware of that one.

> it seemed to go into deaf ears. Hopefully this time someone will listen to you.

I did reply to you and @meshcollider and explained that it was too late to change for 0.18.

> but please don't create things on GUI that don't have any use
Tested gitian builds additionally on Windows 10 (1709) and Ubuntu 16.04.1, working as expected.
unsigned ACK f091dc818085c3fa478374ea4378a0c1dd3d87f2

Code review ACK f091dc818085c3fa478374ea4378a0c1dd3d87f2.
Could code duplication be avoided?
I dont see any nice, clean way if we want to keep current behavior. Not duplicating sending/receiving addresses would require duplicating check for macos.
That said, it would save us a few symbols, though not any lines...
... I take it back, I was thinking about this when I was away from my computer.\nLooks like I managed to decrease the line count by 5 by doing what I had in mind. Thanks for the idea.

Fix (restore) indentation please.

Note that test/lint/lint-whitespace.sh is failing:

> This diff appears to have added new lines with tab characters instead of spaces.
Thanks, didn't notice the indentation mistake. The tab was after _#ifdef Q_OS_MAC_ and I found it almost by mistake. Should be good now.
p.s. is the indentation for _#ifdef Q_OS_MAC_ okay, or should i indent that as well?
